meanings.definition: A garment worn by ancient Romans consisting of a long robe draped over the body.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the actor wore a togae to portray a Roman citizen.
meanings.sent2: During the historical reenactment, many participants donned togae to look authentic.
meanings.sent3: The togae at the costume party made everyone feel like they were in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent4: Her togae of wisdom and experience draped gracefully around her.
meanings.sent5: The togae billowed in the wind, giving him a regal appearance.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'toga'.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various togae from different time periods.
meanings.sent2: At the event, attendees admired the collection of togae on display.
meanings.sent3: The togae in the shop window caught the eye of many passersby.
meanings.sent4: His room was filled with togae, each representing a different era.
meanings.sent5: The togae in the wardrobe seemed to tell stories of the past.
